website_summaries.verdict: Practical for travel and home use. Despite some quality concerns, it has earned a lot of praise for its performance.
pros: Steam channeling technology delivers excellent results
cons: Auto shutoff function is sensitive and tends to shut off when you don't want it to

website_summaries.verdict: Compact and convenient, this travel steamer is a quick alternative to ironing but can't do bigger items such as curtains.
pros: The perfect size for traveling, with a travel pouch, it can also be used every day
It works quickly with just regular tap water
cons: A glove is included because it does spit and splatter at times, and you have to have it really close to the garment for it to work

customer_reviews.title: Such a helpful little gadget!
customer_reviews.text: We love this and no longer use an iron in our household. We bring this when we travel and also use it for general use on fabric at home. Love it! Leaves my clothing wrinkle free and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny & Cat

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this product! Not so small to travel with lightly but it definitely helps in case of emergencies while traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Carm

customer_reviews.title: Works as Adverised
customer_reviews.text: Is this steamer winning any awards? No. Does it do what is advertised? Yes. Reccomend using with a wrinkle release spray for quickest results but also works fine without. It’s small but I can get through a shirt and a dress before needing to refill. Only have used it a handful of times so I can’t speak to its durability but so far no issues. If you’re looking for a lightweight, easy to use steamer for basic dewrinkling needs, this fits the bill. If you’re looking to replace your dry cleaner this probably isn’t for you.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mugo

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this thing!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing!! I bought it as an alternative to an iron (who has time to take out a big ironing board and heat up an iron in the morning??), and it was perfect. Some reviews, I believe, say it runs out of water easily, which I have not found to be true. Just be sure to screw the cap on tightly after refilling because that boiling water WILL spill out onto your hand and it HURTS! I have used this steamer on all kinds of clothes: sweaters, dresses, blazers, light blouses of all colors; it works very well on everything. Super easy to use and very easy to travel with as well.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Steamed it out!!!
customer_reviews.text: not sure why I didn't have one of these little baby before, but I'm glad I have it now! It is a small travel steamer, but it suits my purpose fine. I needed a steamer to steam dance attire (long dresses, pants, tops) that are supposed to be wrinkle free, but usually needs steaming. I used my steamer on the long dress in the photo and although it I had to refill it 3 times (because it is small), it worked really well on getting the wrinkles out. I am impressed with it. I only had it a few months, but I expect to be using it quite frequently. I recommend it for small to medium steam jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Ms.MonroeMMM

customer_reviews.title: ... and was in need of a steamer that would easily fit in my suitcase or carry on bag
customer_reviews.text: I travel often for work and was in need of a steamer that would easily fit in my suitcase or carry on bag. I was online and searched through many to cokme across this steamer which does everything I need . I fill it with water and it takes maybe 3 minutes to start steaming once plugged in. I usually can steam 3 shirts with out having to refill the water and wait for it heat back up. This steamer does a great job of getting out tough wrinkles with little effort, which is great when you have a business meeting to go to that morning. This product is now an essential part of my travel gear on every trip.
customer_reviews.author: Slyeclover1988

customer_reviews.title: Eventually stops steaming continuously
customer_reviews.text: This is a good steamer, but make sure that it can keep the steam going. I bought one and gave it to my brother, but the second one I purchased had issues with the heat in that it couldn't keep the steam going for more than a few seconds at a time. Really inconvenient. 1/27/2019 Edit: The original steamer has been having the same issues as the second for quite a while now. I really don't recommend this steamer anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT THROW YOUR BOX AWAY AFTER YOU OPEN THE STEAMER!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy the first time I used the steamer. It did not take long for the steam to generate and it worked on my blouse perfectly. I was so disappointed the second time I used it (3 days later). Once the water was heated it just sat there spitting out the extremely hot water. I kept waiting for it to stop and the steam to start but that didn’t happen until almost all of the water was gone. The steam finally started but only lasted 30 seconds and then there was no more water. This process went on and on until I ironed my blouse instead. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: It spits out water and is all over my shirt even tho I filled it to the line. Barely and steam comes out of it and when it does it does not clear any of the wrinkles . I am very disappointed in the product and hoped it worked as well as its competitors . I would like to return it or upgrade to one that works properly . Once again I'm very disappointed with the quality of the product . The steamer itself is nice but does not function properly !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Abigail Rouch

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Hassle
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, this steamer did its job at getting out wrinkles. It's the perfect travel sie, heats up quickly, and easy to use. But The darn thing leaks EVERYWHERE. I work in the entertainment and media industry and am use steamers of all kinds for costumes/wardrobe. This little guy leaks through every seam (where the plastic meets plastic) on its body, and gets the majority of wrinkles out (but not all). I did use it for a little under a month to get used to it, but nothing I did seemed to help. Just pa more money and get something a bit better. This wasn't worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: SamG

customer_reviews.title: Spraying Boiling Water EVERYWHERE
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write bad reviews, but this product started to spray water all over my clothes after the third use. Hot boiling water burning on my hands was not fun, I'd be more than willing to write a better review if I'd be able to try the product without these negative defects of getting my clothes wet instead of steamed. I've one of these products before from a different company and it worked just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed, why was this labeled as "Amazon's Choice
customer_reviews.text: The steamer showed up yellowish/purple, obviously old and turned a different color since it is supposed to be white - how long has this been sitting the warehouse? Still decided to keep it because who cares, it's just a color, but I shouldn't of, it is old and defective - extremely dangerous! I held the steamer upright, never tilted, used as instructed, and water spout out everywhere! HOT WATER! Not once did I even tilt the steamer and as it was heating up (sitting up right) water was shooting everywhere! I picked it up and tried steaming my shirt, and steam never even came out. Extremely disappointed, why was this labeled as "Amazon's Choice?"
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased this after reading the many great reviews and was very disappointed. This steamer doesn't do a great job steaming clothing. It doesn't heat up the water enough and will for lack of a better term gurgle and release warm water intermittently from the steamer. It just isn't durable or of good quality. Spend your money elsewhere and do not believe the good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: NP

customer_reviews.title: Great little invention for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Still have it after 3 years. My son took it for his interviews and traveling with it was easy! Just don’t forget to pour out the water! For the price I paid, it’s worked pretty well after weekly use. The down side is that because it is small, its heat output is not as great so you do have to pass the steamer through the same area sometimes twice. Also beware that there will be visible water residue deposits after a few days to weeks and you should clean that up.
customer_reviews.author: Acentos

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Honestly don't know how I've went without one for so long in my life. This works so well its insane. I bought it for my wedding. I bought robes for all my girls and they arrived pretty wrinkled in the mail and this thing took out every single one and worked like a charm. Then everyone also used it to steam their dresses for day of, we had some travel involved to our wedding location and wrinkles happen in the commute but this was just the trick for everyones dresses. Really can't recommend it enough. Its a good price and good quality and it works. A must for special events like a wedding to ensure everything is wrinkle free perfection.
customer_reviews.author: khaleesi

customer_reviews.title: I bought this steamer a year ago, but have ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this steamer a year ago, but have had a few issues on and off, starting after about 6 months of use (where the steam just stopped coming out). Cleaning it was a temporary fix, but then the other day, it completely went out and made an odd buzzing noise. I'm still giving it 4 stars because: 1.) When it was working, it was a highly effective tool! 2.) When I contacted customer service regarding my issue, they responded the next day apologizing and sent out a replacement unit which I receive just a few days later. That makes me have confidence in this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M. Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Performs great!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first fabric steamer and I'm impressed! It's a lot easier than using an iron. This unit puts out a lot of steam! I was able to de-wrinkle a pair of pants in less than 5 minutes. I'm sure a more experienced user would be even faster. It heats up within seconds. Its size is good for travel. The water reservoir holds about 8 oz of water. I used a tiny half-pint bottle of water to fill it and it was a perfect size. It does need distilled water to prevent build-up. It comes with a crease maker on top, as well as a few head attachments. Overall, I'm very pleased with this steamer!
customer_reviews.author: AshKum

customer_reviews.title: Not the best functionality
customer_reviews.text: I have a normal size steamer and got this one for travel. It is an option, however some of the functions compared for my regular size and ridiculous. The water in the container literally boils hard and over, the first time started uncontrollably spraying boiling water everywhere. I somewhat got a handle of that, but when you use it work very funny. First it boils for like 5 seconds and then gives steam for 5 seconds. So when using you have to wait 5 seconds standing and start again. Still like steaming better then ironing but I could think of many improvements of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Marianska

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last a week before it broke.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this steamer for a two week trip. The first four days, it worked great - started steaming super quick and could do one shirt/dress before needing refilled. On day five, I plugged it in, the light came on and it never got hot enough to produce steam. I had read other reviews that said that this happened but then they gave an update saying that the company replaced it and they were happy... so I assumed the company had addressed this problem, but apparently not. I was so disappointed that my entire family was stuck wearing wrinkled clothes for the remaining week and a half.
customer_reviews.author: Raegan Rogers

customer_reviews.title: This portable (and powerful) little steamer packs a 👊 and just makes life EASIER! Love
customer_reviews.text: I honestly just don't know how I made it to 36 years of age without one of these bad boys! My clothes are perfectly wrinkle free without the hassle of always bringing out the iron, or my huge (dust collecting) furniture steamer. My gosh, I just love it, and it's so lightweight and PORTABLE!! Seriously, just buy it. Make your life easier and look GOOD doin it👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Miss Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: UPDATED
customer_reviews.text: I've had this steamer for a year and I loved it at first. But now the steamer produces steam for maybe 30 seconds and then it stops producing steam for 30 seconds and it continues with these intervals. It's a little annoying and takes longer to get clothes wrinkle-free. It seems like it's a common problem from what I've read in the reviews. UPDATE: Almost immediately after I posted my review, the company contacted me and offered to give me a refund as well as a new steamer! I was shocked. But I got my new steamer right away! Wonderful customer service. We haven't tried the new steamer just yet, but I'm sure it'll work!
customer_reviews.author: dezondra

customer_reviews.title: Hated it.
customer_reviews.text: Wondering if I got a lemon .... This was the first steamer I'd ever used so I wasn't really sure what to expect. Hated using this product right away. Leaks water everywhere. Only steams for seconds before you have to wait again for steam to build up. Took forever to steam clothes. I really hated using it. I tried another brand which worked great. So I'm wondering if this one was just defective?? Hard to believe it would work that poorly by design. I'd love a replacement? In exchange for a good review!?
customer_reviews.author: clares

customer_reviews.title: Good Steamer for the Price Point
customer_reviews.text: The steamer works well and has a good output of very hot steam. Only used it once thus far and it did a decent job on a very wrinkled heavy cotton shirt (thought I would test on the toughest shirt in the house). It did take a couple of attempts but the crumpled shirt is now presentable and passable. I would imagine the steamer works much more efficiently on everyday pressing needs. Oh yes, personally I would not consider its size to be great for regular travelling.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just as described; works well after heating up and spitting a little water. P.S. After a short time the steamer began to have issues: the heating element cycled on/off/on/off. Lots of spitting water. I sent an email to the company and they quickly responded. After reading about the issues I was having they immediately sent out a new unit. There are so many good reviews about this product that I feel sure I must have gotten the out-of-the-ordinary lemon. I recommend this company highly for listening to this buyer's concerns, and for making things right. Thank you PurSteam!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Haskell

customer_reviews.title: hard to work with
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my travel. I was happy with the small size and good action. the only problem is that you should hold it right in just a straight position, otherwise it starts spitting water on your clothes and it takes a longer time to dry it again. also, it really should have come with a heat protection gloves. on vacation, there are not enough tools or accessories around to help, so I burned myself couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: Mahsa Esfand

customer_reviews.title: I love this steamer!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this steamer!!! I don’t like iron and ironing boards and there is no room for an ironing board either. My husband’s work clothes always get so wrinkled and it doesn’t look good. I used this steamer on one of my shirts for the first time today. It heated up good to use within 2 minutes. The power cord is super long as well, which is awesome. It’s convenient, perfect for travel, or if you have no room for a bulky ironing board, like me. I shared before and after photos of my shirt after I steamed it. The pictures speak for themselves. If you are considering buying this steamer, I say GO FOR IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Angelika Long

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful!
customer_reviews.text: This little steamer is so powerful! It gets rid of wrinkles that my giant Conair steamer cannot! Just half a whiff of this releases deep set wrinkles. I recommend this little product so much. Not only that, they give you a heat proof glove so that you can hold the fabric taut while you steam it without getting steamed yourself! The only thing is that I wish it has a bigger capacity but that would make this steamer heavier and more tiring to hold, so it doesn't matter. I do this right beside my sink so I can refill right away.
customer_reviews.author: dty2

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I got this steamer because I only need to steam a few items of clothing about once a month. This works perfectly for me. It has a small reservoir for water so I have to refill it at least once during my use, I'd say I get 1-1.5 shirts done with one fill. Be careful of reading directions -- if you tilt the steamer it WILL spill and burn you. Just follow the directions and you'll be fine. I don't travel but I can see this being useful for a frequent traveler. Very pleased with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: mscheirer

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for travel and on clothing that is difficult to iron
customer_reviews.text: The size is very convenient for travel. I took this to my sisters wedding and it was a lifesaver! The steam nozzle is a bit narrow and requires several passes over one area to ensure proper steaming. One recommendation to the manufacturers would be to improve the steam coverage. Note: the steamer will build up calcium deposits, and will do so depending on the water you use. Its best to use filtered water but if you can't, you'll need to clean it with vinegar now and then.
customer_reviews.author: david_nyc

customer_reviews.title: Too small to complete most jobs
customer_reviews.text: This little steamer throws out some steam. But it’s so small that it would need to be re filled over and over and over again to complete most anything. I like that it was light weight and convenient/ portable but more work and time than might be worth. Also no button to hold / push for steam to come out, its continuous til it runs out. I tried it for an hour or two and decided it just wasn’t what I was looking for Contacted Amazon for return, the next day UPS showed to pick up. Easy order, easy return, Thank you Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: The company contacted me and sent me a replacement, which was very kind of them. The product worked perfectly fine for and once again began to act like my previous one. Spurting got water and now it only steams for a few seconds at a time making it difficult to steam something in a pinch. ———- Absolutely loved it the first three times. After that, scalding hot water would just spill out. I tried cleaning it various times but nothing. Hot water kept spilling out and I burnt myself a few times. Wish this little steamer would've lasted as I really need it when I travel for work...I guess I'll have to search for a different one
customer_reviews.author: ale227

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Filled it about half way defiantly below the max line put it on the table (Flat surface) and turned it on to heat, I was waiting for the steam, a couple min later it was projectile spitting boiling water everywhere without being touched or moved luckily I was not near the spout the plug was a bit far so I was able to unplug it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Although I liked how quickly it heats up
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't wait for this steamer to arrive. As soon as it got here (today), I pulled out a few pieces of my 9 month olds clothing to test it out. Although I liked how quickly it heats up, it hardly removed any of the wrinkles. I followed the (very simple) instructions and suggestions. Before I could even finish her dress, it was out of water. I already started a return with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: kailyn

customer_reviews.title: Great Streamer
customer_reviews.text: I used this steamer as soon as I got it in the mail. I was excited to see how it works. And it didn't disappoint. I can't believe I waited this long to get a steamer! I don't like ironing my clothes. This steamer is small but oh so mighty!!! I steamed 5 shirts in no time, only refill the water once. You have to be careful when using this product, it does get pretty hot. I don't have anything to hang my clothes, so I was holding it in one hand and steaming with the other. All in all I recommend this product. Great product, great value, win-win!
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Stops working, spills hot water everywhere
customer_reviews.text: It worked the first 20 minutes that I had it. Now it shuts off and comes back on for no reason. It also consistently spills hot water everywhere no matter how tightly you seal the top portion. I can live with things that don't work too well but get the job done, but this is just a time consuming burn hazard...when it's working. Which is usually doesn't. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: TrekandTech

customer_reviews.title: Great little steamer!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great steamer and it’s perfect for traveling! I had my old one for 2years before it finally died out on me. The only reason why I gave 4stars is because I bought this exact steamer 2years ago and it came with a complementary dust bag for traveling, when I received my new replacement steamer NO DUST BAG 😒.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Williams

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE!  Better than $100+ models!
customer_reviews.text: This steamer has changed my life! I used to work in retail and the shop had a commercial garment steamer. Since then I have owned a couple $100+ home steamers and have been sorely disappointed. This little steamer has the steaming power of the commercial steamer that I fell in love with and is small enough for me to bring on my travels. I normally only bring a carryon when I travel, so the fact that this is about the size of a water 1 liter bottle is amazing. I've raved about how amazing this thing is so much that my mom and brother purchased their own!
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: CHEAPLY MADE, LASTED 6 MONTHS (NOT GOOD FOR INTERNATIONAL TRAVEL)
customer_reviews.text: Okay. So initially I loved this little hand held steamer. It gets the water hot and bubbling and steams clothes fairly well. However, the entire reason I purchased it was for travel. While in Portugal, using an adapter I plugged it in and the steamer stopped working. Cheaply made for sure and not compatible with travel outside of the U.S. I assume. Spend your money elsewhere if you need a reliable travel steamer, this is not it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, until it didn't.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this little steamer at first- it heated it up so quickly and worked like a charm. For someone who hates ironing and elects to wear black to avoid ironing, this was a life saver when traveling for client meetings. However, several uses in the device started to spew out boiling water- essentially hosing my clothes down. I gave up on it after a while, but maybe I just received a defective product, i don't know.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thought it would work better
customer_reviews.text: It works well, but I can’t say it’s not kind of a hassle to use due to it spewing about half the tanks water out before emitting steam. If I leave it sitting upright, and don’t tilt it forward while I’m holding it, it’s spits water out all over the place. This means I have to hold it the entire time while I wait for it to heat up, and leave a towel on the floor if I have to set it down... pretty annoying tbh. Wouldn’t recommend it for travel unless you want to clean up water!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Steamer
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect size for apartment living with not a lot of storage space. I have recently gotten some shirts that wrinkle, but are made of material that I would not want to take an iron to. This steamer has been good with straightening out those items. Since it is a travel size it doesn't hold enough water to go through more than a few items of clothing per fill-up. It's perfect for my needs though. The only down side is that sometimes it spits out water than gets onto the garments. Not the worst as it's not ruining the clothes, just a bit of a nuisance, but it's not all the time.
customer_reviews.author: dancerbabe12

customer_reviews.title: simplest way to iron!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the steamer, due to moving to a small one-bedroom apartment, and no longer having room for a large ironing board and iron. I have already used the steamer to iron several pieces of clothing, as well as curtains, and have been extremely pleased and surprised at the results. Your steamer was quick and easy to operate, and surprisingly gave me just as good, if not better results than if I had pulled out my large, cumbersome ironing board! I only wished I had purchased one of your steamers sooner, as I honestly never would've guessed the results would've been so wonderful and the process so simple and quick!
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Is this supposed to spit out so much water that it soaks whatever I'm trying to steam? I'd rather fill a spray bottle with hot water, at least it would mist instead of flying out in huge droplets. It starts to steam only when it's almost empty. I've never overfilled it. Either mine is defective or this product is just junk. Follow up: I have placed a return and shipping this asap but, I was contacted by the company today to ask if I'd like a free replacement. Really great customer service. awaiting the new one to see if my first steamer was just defective. Follow up 2: used the replacement and it steams and without dripping 🙌🏻
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Not Too Bad
customer_reviews.text: Takes quite a bit of effort to get all the wrinkles out even with wrinkle release spray. It works though.
customer_reviews.author: New York

customer_reviews.title: Unusable, top won't unscrew so you can fill reservoir.
customer_reviews.text: Several people tried to unscrew the top and it is fused to the body and won't turn at all. Totally disappointing transaction. Completely unusable since you can't open it to fill it with water. Doesn't deserve the one star comment requires. Complete waste. Sent back for refund.
customer_reviews.author: just me

customer_reviews.title: PurSteam is a life saver.
customer_reviews.text: PurSteam is a life saver. I do not iron. I'm one of those people who would toss my wrinkled shirt in the dryer and hope that the wrinkles come out. Trust me it does not always work. The PurSteam is fantastic. It takes out horrible wrinkles in a snap. I have read a few reviews where folks have said it leaks etc. I thought I was dealing with the same issue until I realized I was over filling it. My bad. I now fill it up to the line as directed and never had another "leak." It's portable and light. I'm packing it on my next trip and saying goodbye to wrinkled clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri @ KCBR

customer_reviews.title: Beats ironing!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I like this, I really do, but since it's for travel, I do struggle with the length of the cord....I'd love a longer one ;) And it works well! I usually have to hold the steamer against some fabrics to really get the wrinkles out, but that's okay. I have only used it on mostly synthetic or synthetic mixed clothes, and I'd always proceed with caution, but ours works and I love not getting out an ironing board!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Gerlach Puckett

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product, fantastic seller
customer_reviews.text: This steamer works exactly as advertised. Within minutes, the water had heated up and I was taking wrinkles out of my clothes easier than if I had ironed them. It was easy to find a spot in the apartment where the clothing hung straight down as instructed. I will definitely be using this way more than my iron from now on. I would also like to point out the great customer service that I received from the seller. Originally, I received a defective unit and the seller immediately sent me a replacement. I was extremely impressed. Thank you Dianne for a great product and great generosity and attentiveness!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not very well made - I'm sure there are better options
customer_reviews.text: The good: It heats up quickly and the controls are simple - an on/off switch is all there is. The bad: The lid part split along the seam the third time I used it, causing it to spit and dribble boiling water all over the place. Before it broke, I burned my hands a few times while using it - you pretty much have to keep it perfectly level and straight up and down, particularly while it's full, to avoid this. There's also no auto shut off when it runs out of water, and it runs out of water quickly. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle M. Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Steamer for a Stager
customer_reviews.text: I stage property and all of the new linens and stuff always comes with wrinkles, the ones that can be tough to get out and make something brand new look less than perfect. This little workhorse has been put to great use over the last few days and performed extremely well. I found if you follow the fill line closely it comes to life quicker and works better. I should have read directions, but I just went to work with this. Yesterday alone it steamed out 8 curtains, 2 bed skirts, and multiple pillow cases. This was a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Kris M.

customer_reviews.title: Might be good for travel but...
customer_reviews.text: I will begin that I have never used or owned a steamer before this purchase. It is travel size and since I didn't plan on using it for travel this purchase was my mistake. I needed to steam a long gown for a wedding that had wrinkles from packing, handling and altering. This steamer was totally ineffective and I had to end up borrowing a regular size steamer from a friend. So moral of the story when they say "travel size" they mean it.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie Mae

customer_reviews.title: Faulty
customer_reviews.text: Does not work. Read manual and followed it exactly. First time I used it, was fine. Second time, I filled it up to about a cm below the max line, it then heated up and sputtered all of the water out. While it was sitting upright on the counter, in huge squirts of water. I made sure I had the lid properly secure so that wasn’t the issue. I unplugged it and emptied it and left it open to dry for a few hours, came back and tried again. Again tons of spewing hot water came out until the chamber was empty.
customer_reviews.author: Megs

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy way to iron!
customer_reviews.text: The stand up steamer is really convienent. Great to use when in a hurry or if your shirt doesnt need heavy ironing! I use this alot more than your traditional iron because it's so easy. The only complaint I have is our tap water tends to clog up the pours after many uses so occasionally I will need to run vinegar through it like the directions explain. Sounds like they have encountered that same thing. When I called the manufactures number on the box, they were great and explained what to do! It's the tap water and no fault of the steam iron so I didn't reflect that in my ratings.
customer_reviews.author: AH-Rancho Cucamonga, Ca

customer_reviews.title: This steamer is the perfect on the go wrinkle tamer
customer_reviews.text: This steamer is the perfect on the go wrinkle tamer. It is very light, so using it with one hand is no big deal, even when it is full with water. There is a good cord length on the steamer, allowing you some mobility when getting your steam on. This heats up within seconds and shoots out a good deal of steam. I have found that this works better for me compared to an industrial portable steamer I have used. I previously worked in retail, and we had one of these that we used to steam clothes put on mannequins due to its ease, portability, and effectiveness.
customer_reviews.author: D Ford

customer_reviews.title: Avoid! Grows white mold inside and can’t stop the growth
customer_reviews.text: Works well, not as powerful as the last one I have. It takes longer to get going, steam isn’t as powerful. Big note: this gets white mold inside immediately after first use. I cleaned it, disinfected it, next time I opened it up it was covered in white mold. I cleaned it used it. After using it, I dried it completely and put it away. Next time I opened it, it was covered in mold. Bad!
customer_reviews.author: shopaholic727

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it for travel, but I do use it at home for steaming clothes. I hate ironing and this little steamer lets me touch up pants and shirts for my husband--although I do have to get out the iron if I want to get nice creases in them. But it has greatly cut down on my need to iron. I also discovered that this steamer is handy for restoring wool yarn. Just rip out the yarn, roll into a ball, then use the back of a chair to form into a skein, tie the ends, and hang to steam. See photos.
customer_reviews.author: Bhamster

customer_reviews.title: Not Powerful Enough
customer_reviews.text: This product is such a great idea, but it does not function as well as it should. It took about 25-30 mins just to properly steam the BACK of a shirt. Not even the whole shirt! Might as well spend your money on a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but can only use it vertically.
customer_reviews.text: I just received the garment steamer and used it to get the wrinkles of a dress shirt. It worked very well although it took longer than what I was expecting since I had to wait a few minutes to refill it. It would be great if one could use it horizontally not just vertically, that would make it more versatile. Is small to take on a suitcase, even a carry on. It looks sturdy, but I cannot attest to the durability yet that’s why I only gave it one star. We’ll be traveling soon so I will update on how well it performed.
customer_reviews.author: Vanesen

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but leaks
customer_reviews.text: I def prefer this over ironing. The steam takes a while to come out and only last like 10 secs and reheats and repeats. Sometimes it squirts hot water out which is annoying bc you have to let the garment dry and its under the rec fill line too. Ive burned myself a few times holding a garment and steaming too close to my skin and burned and left scars.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: A great small steamer
customer_reviews.text: This is a review for the PurSteam Portable Fabric Steamer. I have had the steamer for a few months now and use it instead of ironing my clothes. It is very easy to set up and easy to use. It removes wrinkles from my clothing quickly and leaves them ready to wear immediately. I like this so much better than an iron because it heats up quickly and also cools down much quicker than an iron and doesn't require a special ironing board. I just hang my shirt on a hook in the bathroom and it works perfectly. I give this product 5 out of 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Momof2boys

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't return it fast enough.
customer_reviews.text: My first attempt to steam was when I started steaming my husband's shirt, it started spewing hot water. Good thing it only got all over the shirt and not on me or my dogs. The shirt was soaked. I followed it's instruction so not sure what went wrong but I didn't want to try again to find out. Burned a little bit of my hands when it started spewing water and unplugged it as fast as I could. It was pretty dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Dingle

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Splattering Junk
customer_reviews.text: This steamer splattered water all over the place. I followed instructions and filled to just below the max fill line with warm water 3 times. I had the same issue each time. I called the phone number given with the steamer for troubleshooting problems. Until I said I bought the steamer from Amazon and was just going to return it if they didn't help with my issue, they weren't going to talk to me without an order #. Then they said it would normally be a problem with overfillling beyond the max fill line. Thank goodness I bought this from Amazon and I can return it hassle free with Prime, because this particular unit is a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: noreen

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool!
customer_reviews.text: This little steamer is great! It holds just the right amount of water, heats up super fast and does the job. The directions are clear and use is simple. There is a good amount of steam that comes out the top for perfect coverage of whatever item needs steaming. I have steamed several things and have used it all of the house for different chores that require steam. Always reliable and very handy. Great little tool! I would definitely recommend and purchase again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: S Huber

customer_reviews.title: Great in the beginning only
customer_reviews.text: This product was great in the beginning and worked really well. However, after months of not using it, I feel this product stopped working and a bit dangerous as hot, boiling water began to spit out of the product instead of just heat.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: A NO BRAINER BUY
customer_reviews.text: Love, Love, Love! I used the tobi steamer and then a tall rowenta steamer. There would be long intervals between steam because of the long hose that it would have to travel up. Where I live the water is also very high in calcium so the deposits that I would have to clean up from buildup were a big hassle. The Pur Steam is heaven, easy, quick, lite weight, and when it's time for cleaning, a little vinegar is all that's needed. Heats up in ONE MINUTE! And takes up little space. Have already recommended to friends!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan P Mugridge

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I am fairly new to steaming. I purchased another brand years ago, but I gave it to someone, as it was bulky and too tedious to fill. This uses tap water, heats effectively, is lightweight, and gets the job done. In my opinion, there's no need to buy a full size if you are just using it for garments/fabric at home. Higher volumes of fabrics may require a larger tank so that you won't have to keep refilling.
customer_reviews.author: atlantageorgia02

customer_reviews.title: Better then an iron
customer_reviews.text: Love the pursteam portable fabric steamer!! My husband and mother in law were completely distraught that I have never ironed a day in my life. When all the baby curtains and beds Skirts came in and were wrinkled they made fun of me until I steamed everything smooth! That shut them up ! Now when we Go to a wedding my husband uses my steamer to get the wrinkles out of his dress shirt instead of bringing it to his mother. Effective mother in law repellant!! It may not put creases in but really who cares about that?
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Sigh.  If only there were a zero star option
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several steamers over the years. This is quite possibly the worst. It spits tons of water. When it is done, it hisses such small amounts of steam, I don't know why it bothers. Do not waste your money. You could breathe on your clothes and have as much wrinkle free effect. I was contacted by the seller after posting this review who let me know that there is a 3 year warranty. Since then I have contacted them three times about how to return this and get a replacement. This has been going on for weeks. My review stands at this point, since obviously the warranty is useless.
customer_reviews.author: pc1000

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful steamer, very efficient
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful steamer, very efficient, works up steam very quickly. I had a different steamer for years that worked with a little screw-on cap. Finally, I managed to lose the little cap, rendering it unusable. This one has a large top (see the line above the water window and button on the handle), which makes it impossible to lose--the entire top part is the lid. It also gives it a large opening, making it easy to fill without spills. If you need a steamer (and you do!), you can't do better than this steamer.
customer_reviews.author: Goodhart Girl

customer_reviews.title: So convenient and works great! Great to travel with.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for 5-6 months and I love this thing! It is so convenient to keep it in my bathroom or closet for a quick steam of a shirt or dress before work. It heats up VERY quickly and it has never sputtered water and made wet spots (like my old steamer did). I travel with it all the time. If you will be needing to steam a lot of things at a time, then I would go with the larger version of this steamer, but if you're just doing a few garments at a time this size is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Louisa Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Spills boiling water all over
customer_reviews.text: No matter how low the level of water is, it just vigorously boils and spills all over. I am not able to use it at all. Edit: The company has offered to give me a replacement. Will update once I receive the product and use it! I am impressed by the company's customer service and their perseverance to make their customers happy. Edit #2: The company sent me a replacement for no extra cost and this one works amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Esha

customer_reviews.title: Struggling with daily use
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to replace my larger steamer that takes up too much room. At first, I thought it worked pretty well.The Pursteam gets the job done, just a little slower than my old one. However, because it is much much smaller, I am okay with it. After about 15 uses (I use it daily for work pants/shirt), sometimes it spontaneously stops heating the water. So I have to power off and power on again. Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. So far I've gotten it to re-heat up the water pretty quick, but still, it's a defect. Nervous about the longevity..
customer_reviews.author: Taylor R

customer_reviews.title: Nice travel sized streamer
customer_reviews.text: Nice travel sized streamer. Bought this for our destination wedding. At first I had trouble getting tough wrinkles out, but their customer service was quick to respond with tips. You have to hold the steamer really close to the garment, like almost less than an inch. I was worried it would stain the dress with water stains or burn it, but it did the trick. We don't have a lot of experience with it yet, but seemed to work better with thinner materials - it steamed my dress no problem, but my husbands suit, we had to use an iron as well for the thicker parts of the jacket. But good value, and will be convenient for future use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy one!
customer_reviews.text: I live using this! I hang my garment on the door, pull the item taut & steam the wrinkles out. The test was on my lab coat, which is difficult to get wrinkle-free. I bought these for Christmas for my two adult kids because I knew they would not iron. Purchasing them as gifts was after I myself owned one. It has a nice drawstring bag that you can stick everything in snug it up and take it with you when you travel as well
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS!  Shoots BOILING WATER before steam.
customer_reviews.text: THIS. IS. DANGEROUS. I read previous negative reviews but still purchased because it said it was newer improved version. I am returning it immediately. I followed all of instructions enclosed. Almost immediately it began spewing boiling WATER - not steam as intended - up to 18” across my counter. If I would have been in its path I would have been SEVERELY burned. Please do not risk your safety for wrinkles. My husband is a recovering burn victim, trust me IT IS NOT WORTH IT.
customer_reviews.author: mary johnson

customer_reviews.title: Small Steamer
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for a little over a week. It’s small, puts out a fair amount of heat. I’m not sure it gets rid of the wrinkles like an iron does and I personally take longer using the steamer than I do the iron. But this is a little more convenient as far as not having to keep the ironing board out and a hot iron out. I put the before and after of the last shirt I used the steamer on. *if you put too much water in the steamer the water will come out and we your clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this steamer 💯.
customer_reviews.text: I love this steamer and have recommended it to friends, who have also purchased and love it. I read about it in a Buzzfeed article, clicked the link in the article and purchased. It is well designed and works like a dream. It heats up fast and wrinkles disappear in seconds. I have no complaints and would repurchase. I will hopefully never have to touch an iron or ironing board again, ever.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works effectively on wrinkles
customer_reviews.text: The first time my husband took it on a business trip and used it, he said it didn’t take out the wrinkles from his dress shirt at all. We were about to send it back, but I thought I’d give it a try first. The only thing I did differently was when I was steaming something, I put the tip of the stranger actually touching the fabric and moved it around. It worked AMAZINGLY!!! I think my husband was just holding it too far away from the cloth. I’m very pleased with this, and look for things to steam all the time!!!
customer_reviews.author: ZMomUtah

customer_reviews.title: Best customer service ever
customer_reviews.text: Best customer service ever!!!!! I am impressed a lot about Stevens's customer service. It was true that ,first time, I was disappointing about leaking product but!! Stevens contacted personally and sincerely care about my product and replaced it even though I bought the product 5 months ago. I think that I will never experience this kind and thoughtful customer service in near future. Again, thanks Stevens. Also the product is very comfortable to handy and work awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: Gun Ho Kang

customer_reviews.title: Great product..........even BETTER customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome customer service! Great product......much easier than ironing. I just hang my garment up on the shower rod and steam it that way and it works way faster and easier than having to get all the junk out to iron. It does work best if you use downy wrinkle release with it. I had a little issue with my steamer and they replaced mine......no questions asked! WONDERFUL customer service! would definitely buy from them again!
customer_reviews.author: Shana_rai

customer_reviews.title: Stopping working after a few uses!
customer_reviews.text: The first few times that I used this steamer, I fell in LOVE. Unfortunately, whenever I use it now, it just spits water onto my garments and, on one occasion, onto my hand (ouch!) I had high expectations seeing all of the reviews so this was a letdown.
customer_reviews.author: UselessPenName

customer_reviews.title: Works better in a humid climate
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a trip abroad. It worked REALLY well where it was slightly humid. Where I live, it's a dry climate and the steamer just does not work as well here. It is very convenient to pack and works better than nothing if you're going somewhere without an iron.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Full steam ahead on this one.
customer_reviews.text: The product is as advertised. Several garments can be steamed with one filling of the tank. The cord is blessedly long, which gives flexibility to steaming garments on a hanger. I bought distilled water but it isn't necessary since it won't be a available when traveling. But for home use, it's inexpensive and may help to avoid any mineral build-up, depending on the local water. The steamer really does a great job of refreshing garments, and saves some ironing. It's super for wool and wool blend items. Shipping time was amazingly fast.
customer_reviews.author: Cholly

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Steamer
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the PurSteam Portable Fabric Steamer. This is the first time I've owned a steamer before and it's much easier to use than an iron! I love that it is portable because it makes it so much easier to use than the stand up steamers. It's easy to fill, it heats up extremely fast and it takes out the wrinkles like a breeze. My clothes are always wrinkle-free thanks to this steamer and I'd definitely buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Mckaela Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Severely Burned
customer_reviews.text: While using this steamer on Saturday, I was severely burned! The water came boiling out of the handle, and from the bottom! Thankfully, I’m married to a physician whom took care of my burns immediately and I had the correct burn cream at my disposal so that I didn’t have to wait until being seen in the ER. The machine is great initially, dangerous within a year (and little usage).
customer_reviews.author: Brandy David

customer_reviews.title: Product was Defective!
customer_reviews.text: Awful product! I arrived home to see the paper cover soaked with rain on my steps. The box inside fell apart when I picked it up, but the steamer was wrapped inside the manufacturer's box in plastic and was only slightly wet. I let it dry and threw away the packaging. I put in the distilled water I also use for my iron. It spit water everywhere as you can see in the pictures. I also cant return it because the packing materials fell apart in my hand from being left in the rain by delvery person. Thankfully, no one was hurt by the scalding water.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stop ironing, start steaming!
customer_reviews.text: My husband frequently travels for work, and he often needs shirts to be wrinkle-free last minute. I don't have the time to help pull out the ironing board, fill an iron with water, and go over every crease on his crinkled clothes, so my sister suggested a steamer. This PurSteam has been a lifesaver. While we initially had to figure out how to fill and hold it exactly (DON'T overfill or tip it at an angle or you'll get water splotches!), we've learned how to use it efficiently...and it has made a big difference. We take in on all of our trips, because it's light and compact.
customer_reviews.author: WT

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective & Slow
customer_reviews.text: This was a big disappointment in a product. I wanted something that would work to remove wrinkles from a dress shirt while I was on-the-road and couldn't bring an iron with me. Simply put, this thing barely gets wrinkles out. The capacity is so low and it takes so long that you'll probably have to refill it even for a single shirt. Pros: It's compact and would easily fit in a suitcase. Cons: It works very poorly at removing wrinkles.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Robison

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fill
customer_reviews.text: I own a womens clothing store and purchased this steamer for small quick jobs. It ironically ended up being our "go to" steamer. It is much easier to handle than my large commercial steamer and the workers at the store prefer this over the larger steamer. Easy to fill, easy to clean... just remember to NOT fill it past the fill line. I did this by mistake and you can get a small burst of water out the top. Heats up fast! Definitely the best steamer I have purchased in the past many years. I would purchase it again if ever needed, but so far this steamer is still working perfectly. Definitely a winner! m.p.
customer_reviews.author: fox whisperer

customer_reviews.title: This is not a good product for curtains but for a shirt or dress of made of light material only.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to steam satin curtains. It spits water and steam for first 2-3 minutes first then when water line down to half then all steam. Maximum use time 8-10 before you must refill again. I followed directions specifically prior to use. When in use, I did not tilt it. I did not go above fill line.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Miller

customer_reviews.title: Small size easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of sewing so I have been looking for a steamer. This little Pur Steam elite travel steamer is perfect. Its small and lightweight. It has a 9 foot cord which makes things so much easier. I really am impressed with this steamer. It works really well. All the wrinkles were removed with little effort at all. Just add water and it only takes a couple of minutes to heat up. I got a few of my skirts done and a blouse today that I have been putting off because ironing is my least favorite chore. I think I will try sewing a little this weekend. The steamer actually made it fun.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for a dress for a wedding that I was traveling too. It was small so it fit in my suitcase without taking up a lot of room. My dress was very wrinkled due to packing it in a suitcase so I was relying heavily on the steamer. To my disappointment, it did not get the wrinkles out at all. Several different people even tried because I thought maybe I wasn’t using it correctly but no one had luck with their garments either
customer_reviews.author: Katie Watts

customer_reviews.title: ... so disappointed- I bought it because of all the great reviews so I'm thinking maybe I got a sour ...

customer_reviews.title: One happy and satisfied PurSteam customer!
customer_reviews.text: What a lovely product! It got delivered on time, even sooner than I expected. I was getting ready to go to a Christmas party the other night and I didn’t like the dress I was gonna wear. So I had to pull out a long sleeve top in a hurry and this PurSteam Garment Steamer saved my day! I just plugged it in and what seemed like around one minute my PurSteam was ready. So efficient. I like it very much! I will surely recommend to others.,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst purchase from amazon. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: This product is not worth a penny! Cheap item delivered. Hardly steams one cloth in one refill. I used mineral water and still there were deposits found inside the steamer just after using three times. Would not recommend if you are looking to save time. The clothes get wet while steaming so you cannot wear them immediately. Also, be careful while using because the water pops out of the steamer while steaming the clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Saloni

customer_reviews.title: Good for Home or Travel
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews, and I was doubtful. But I still gave it a try. This little steamer is AMAZING. It is easy to use and works perfectly. I put my blouse on a plastic hanger, turned on the steamer, and a few minutes later it was wrinkle free. I filled it up again, they did a dress. Be sure to read the directions - this steamers comes well packaged, with a mitt included (be careful not to get the steam on your skin). I use it at home, but there is a storage bag, and it is small enough to toss in my suitcase when I am traveling on business. No more Hotel Irons for me!!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: I'm still searching for the perfect portable steamer
customer_reviews.text: I'm still searching for the perfect portable steamer. My prior steamer died after 3 months, so I tried this one. Its still kicking but its started "pausing" every minute or so. The best way to describe it is a brief power loss to the heating mechanism, so the steam stops for 30 seconds to a minute, then starts back up and steaming resumes...then the process repeats itself. The "pausing" is also getting worse - both with longer lapses in steam and more occurrences per cycle. Its just super frustrating, especially when you are on the road and trying to get out the door in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Ashby

customer_reviews.title: Practical & Light
customer_reviews.text: Never used one of these before, so my review is based on my first time usage. It’s light and convenient for packing. The instructions tell you not to go over the max line which I didn’t listen to and as I used my blouse was wet from the overfill. I’m gonna say it is more convenient then using an iron but I don’t think you get the same quality of pressing. Heats the water fast this particular one doesn’t have a big reservoir so light need to refill a couple of times for one blouse. Not knocking the product as bad due to my inexperience with it.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: Love this little steamer!!!
customer_reviews.text: Totally in love with this little steamer. I had purchased a competing brand previous to this one and boy did I regret that purchase. I stumbled upon this one and it is a work horse. Quick to heat up. Gets the wrinkles out quickly and takes up no space at all. I highly recommend this to everyone!!!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Mullen

customer_reviews.title: Nice little steamer
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my mother, she liked it so much she asked for another one. She keeps one at home and takes the other out of town. She’s a little clumsy and has burned herself with it pretty badly, so be careful 😅
